structure.unit: STATE UNIVERSITIES AND COLLEGES -- REGIONAL EDUCATION -- ARCHAEOLOGY

law.text: There is established and created in the State Treasury a fund entitled the "Kentucky Enterprise Fund" for the purpose of enabling small or medium-size, Kentucky-based companies to undertake feasibility, concept development, research and development, or commercialization work in partnership with colleges and universities in the Commonwealth. The fund may receive state appropriations, gifts, grants, federal funds, revolving funds, and any other funds both public and private. Moneys deposited in the fund shall be disbursed by the State Treasurer upon the warrant of the secretary of the Finance and Administration Cabinet. Any unallocated or unencumbered balances in the fund shall be invested as provided in KRS 42.500(9), and any income earned from the investments along with the unallotted or unencumbered balances in the fund shall not lapse, and shall be deemed a trust and agency account and made available solely for the purposes and benefits of the Kentucky Enterprise Fund Program.
law.history: Amended 2008 Ky. Acts ch. 98, sec. 2, effective July 15, 2008. -- Created 2000 Ky. Acts ch. 522, sec. 5, effective July 14, 2000.
